p: Zika virus infection (ZVI) was first reported in humans in 1954, but only in 2007 was the first-ever outbreak reported in Micronesia [ 1, 2]. Several small outbreaks in Micronesia and the Pacific Islands have been reported since then, and then ZVI started revealing its epidemic potential [ 3]. In 2015, the virus was associated with neurological disorders, including Guillain-Barr√© syndrome, microcephaly and still unknown abnormalities in newborns infants [ 4, 5]. It was and yet remains an event surrounded by many scientific uncertainties.
